Package org.sopra.api

Interface Game

All Superinterfaces:
ExerciseSubmission
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSunEnergyBroker
public interface Game
extends ExerciseSubmission
A game contains the phases that are executed on a scenario. The game is separated in 2 parts:
  • Build phase
  • Execution phase
First, the build phase is executed. After the build phase, the execution phase begins. The execution phase itself consists of rounds. Each round, the wind and the energy consumption change depending on the time of the day. To react on these fluctuations, commands can be executed to regulate controllable power plants and consumers.
See Also:
Statistics

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void buildPhase​(Scenario scenario)
    This phase is called before the scenario actually starts.
    void executionPhase​(Scenario scenario, int round)
    This phase is called for each round of the execution phase.

    Methods inherited from interface org.sopra.api.exercises.ExerciseSubmission

    getTeamIdentifier

  • Method Details

    • buildPhase

      void buildPhase​(Scenario scenario)
      This phase is called before the scenario actually starts. (In other words in round 0.) During this phase, power lines can be upgraded and power plants can be built on transformer station locations.
      Parameters:
      scenario - Scenario of the game

    • executionPhase

      void executionPhase​(Scenario scenario, int round)
      This phase is called for each round of the execution phase. In each round, the non-controllable energy nodes change their input or output of energy. This can be a random change or one that depends on specific factors (e.g.: solar plants which produce specific energy dependent on day time). During each round several commands can be executed to regulate controllable energy nodes.
      Parameters:
      scenario - Scenario of the game
      round - Round as number
